intro: Anodendron seramense, commonly known as the Seram anodendron, is a flowering plant native to the island of Seram in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
